AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: Defendant and appellant convicted of conspiracy to bring or attempt to bring undocumented aliens into the United States, involved in smuggling operation with Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, raised several claims of prejudicial error on appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal of Alfredo Ortega-Chavez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez: Co-conspirator, van driver, and participant in the smuggling operation with Ortega-Chavez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, charged with attempting to bring illegal aliens into the United States, government witness with inconsistent testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado: Co-conspirator and participant in the smuggling operation with Ortega-Chavez and Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez, arrested for being an undocumented alien
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Graciela Castaneda: Witness for the appellant, testified about having brunch with the appellant on November 22, 1980, and provided alibi testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father: Rebuttal witness who testified that the appellant was in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 22, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother: Rebuttal witness who testified that she saw the appellant in Sabinas Hidalgo on the evening of November 21, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Sanchez's parents: Rebuttal witnesses who testified against the appellant's alibi
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ms. Salinas: Defense counsel and acquaintance of juror Mrs. Guerrero
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mrs. Guerrero: Juror who knew Ms. Salinas and was questioned about her ability to be impartial, indicated she could remain fair and impartial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: Trial court judge who conducted an inquiry into Mrs. Guerrero's ability to remain impartial and ensured a fair trial
